action.content:
You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Only reply with an action.
For example:
> open cupboard

You can have up to two objects in your inventory at the same time.

Your goal for this game is: Put the pillow in the refrigerator, the book in the wardrobe and the plate on the shelf.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

You are in a living room now. There are a side table, a table, a couch and a chair. There is a passage to a hallway here.
You are in a hallway now. There is a potted plant. The potted plant is on the floor. There are passages to a kitchen, a living room, a broom closet and a bedroom here.
You are in a kitchen now. There are a counter and a cupboard. The cupboard is closed. There are passages to a hallway and a pantry here.
The cupboard is now open. In the cupboard there are a book and a plate.
You take the book. In your inventory you have a book.
You are in a pantry now. There are a freezer and a refrigerator. The freezer is closed. The refrigerator is closed. There is a passage to a kitchen here.
The refrigerator is now open. In the refrigerator there are a sandwich, a orange, a banana, a peach and a apple.

> go to living room was incorrect so > go to bedroom 

No that is incorrect 
> go to wardrobe or look for a pillow so > go to bedroom was not an option 
> go to living room was not here 
> go to hallway then living room then wardrobe no 
> go to living room no 
How about 
> go to living room no 
> go to wardrobe no 
> go to living room no 
How about
